intro: Hieracium cheiloptilotum, commonly known as the white hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of northern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its flowers are yellow with white ray florets, and it produces achenes as its seeds. It is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a weed in some regions.
